intro: Daphnidium venosum, commonly known as the veined daphnidium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically narrow and alternate, with a distinct venation pattern that gives the plant its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
